byline.contributor: Charles V. Bagli reported from New Orleans, and Marc Santora from New York.
byline.original: By CHARLES V. BAGLI and MARC SANTORA

abstract: Lawyers for millionaire murder suspect Robert A Durst are seeking to call agents who arrested him in New Orleans as witnesses in bid to prove evidence gathered at arrest was obtained illegally; hope to keep Durst from facing felony weapons and drug charges in New Orleans before being extradited to Los Angeles for murder trial; government has under a week to produce agents or convince judge that they should not be called.
lead_paragraph: A battle over weapons and drug charges in Louisiana is a prelude to what is expected to be a bitter court fight in California, where Mr. Durst is accused of killing his longtime confidante.

headline.main: Robert Durst’s Lawyers Want to Call the Agents Who Arrested Him as Witnesses
headline.print_headline: Lawyers for Durst Want to Call as Witnesses the Agents Who Arrested Him

snippet: A battle over weapons and drug charges in Louisiana is a prelude to what is expected to be a bitter court fight in California, where Mr. Durst is accused of killing his longtime confidante.
